    		Enterprise Applications
    	Enterprise Applications (EAPP) is responsible for enterprise-wide computing applications that support core University business processes. This includes systems in the following areas:
                        EAPP Projects
                    Project PortfoliosProject RequestsMore about EAPP Projects...
                        Customer Engagement
                    Chico State 360PortalMore about Customer Engagement...
                        Digital Transformation
                    Adobe SignOnBasePerceptive ContentUnity FormsMore about Digital Transformation...
                        Integrations & Development

                        Learning Technologies
                    BlackboardKalturaTurnitinZoomMore about Learning Technologies...
                        PeopleSoft
                    Campus SolutionsHuman ResourcesFinanceMore about PeopleSoft...
                        Training Management
                    CSU LearnLinkedIn LearningCompliance trainingSafety trainingMore about Training Management...Technology Planning Involvement EAPP staff members serve on Chico State's technology planning committees such as the University Technology Advisory Committee (UTAC), and also serve on several CSU system technology planning committees including CSU Technical Architecture Group (TAG) and CSU CMS Technical User Group (TUG).Join our teamEmployment and Experience OpportunitiesMiscellaneous ResourcesEAPP GlossaryData at Chico StateStaff can also refer to CSYou(opens in new window) for CSU-wide Collaborative Groups, Policies, Tools and Services, and Projects and Initiatives.Information TechnologyKendall Hall, 109www.csuchico.edu/itSupport Our CollegeMore in our divisionComputing & Communication ServicesCreative Media & TechnologyEnterprise ApplicationsInformation SecurityInstitutional Research and Strategic Analytics (IRSA)IT Administrative ServiceIT Support ServicesTechnology Equity and Inclusion
We acknowledge and are mindful that Chico State stands on lands that were originally occupied by the first people of this area, Mechoopda, and we recognize their distinctive spiritual relationship with this land, the flora, the fauna, and the waters that run through campus. We are humbled that our campus resides upon sacred lands that since time immemorial have sustained the Mechoopda people and continue to do so today.Contact UsNeed Help?FacebookFacebookTwitterTwitterInstagramInstagramReport an accessibility issueReport a broken link on this pageTitle IXPrivacy PolicyCalifornia State University, Chico400 West First StreetChico, CA 95929Copyright © 2023 All Rights Reserved
